column4: How do you get Breezy to install on a Dell GX280 with an SATA drive?
I tried default first, and expert as well, both hang at the same point
then it ran fine
the main trick is that the hard drives are sda/b rather than hda/b
what are you seeing?
it hangs when going into the partitioning mode
are you in expert mode or default mode?
on one dell (which wasn't exactly the same model as yours) I had to stop the SATA module from loading during install
tell me more :-D
it then used hda/b etc.  then I had to boot a rescue cd, edit fstab, and change hda to sda, hdb to sdb, etc.
let me check which sata that thing uses.  hold on a moment
yes, once I figured this part out (which took a long time, as you might imagine) everything went smoothly
cool.  thanks for the info
this one is using the Intel ICH6M sata 9aka 82801fbm)
another solution is to partition first with another distro, then install ubuntu and tell it to use the existing partitions
but this doesn't always work in this situation, because you still need to list the partitions and tell it which ones to use
and that still might fail.  But it did work for me once.
you can gather info by using the distro cd to boot into a shell and running the hardware detection program on the command line.
that shows you udev designations for the hard drives, which map to hda/sda/whatever, but the mapping is a bit arcane
I do appreciate your help,  thanks much
hope it works out for you.
